channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KS

item.title: Report E-2023081048
item.description:
Report E-2023081048

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-03
  • City: SALINA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the metal 55 gallon drum of paraffin dispersant (un1993) had been punctured by a nail and had released 32 ounces of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023081052
item.description:
Report X-2023081052

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-05
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE. THE RESPONDER CONSULTED THE UPS DECISION TREE AND DONNED ALL PPE. THE LEAKING PACKAGE AND ALL DEBRIS WERE TAKEN TO THE DMP AREA. ALL CONTAMINATED ITEMS WERE DISPOSED OF FOLLOWING UPS DISPOSAL PROCEDURES.

item.title: Report X-2023080817
item.description:
Report X-2023080817

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-06T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-08
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: MANAGER NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS LEAKING AND NOTIFIED QA. QA PLACED THE PACKAGE IN A LINED TOTE AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TAKEN TO THE PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE BOTTLE HAD A LOOSE CAP AND LEAKED OUT SOILING THE BOX. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE.

item.title: Report X-2023080786
item.description:
Report X-2023080786

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-06T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-08
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE HANDLER NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS LEAKING INSIDE THE TRAILER WHILE UNLOADING AND NOTIFIED THE MANAGER. QA PLACED THE PACKAGE IN A LINED TOTE AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TAKEN TO THE PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: ALL OF THE BOTTLES WERE LEAKING OUT FROM AROUND THE CAPS SOILING THE BOX. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE.

item.title: Report E-2023080918
item.description:
Report E-2023080918

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-05T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-15
  • City: TOPEKA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 15, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of Heptanes leaked approximately twenty-five (25) gallons to the trailer interior due to a faulty seam. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration (ER) to remediate the site. ER personnel loaded the damaged drum into one (1) 85-gallon overpack for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023080332
item.description:
Report X-2023080332

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-26
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: X-2023080332: SUPERVISOR CALLED IN A LEAKING HAZMAT. DMP RESPONDED BY SENDING A RESPONDER WITH FULL SPILL CART AND PPE. RESPONDER ARRIVED AND CONSULTED THE DECISION TREE. RESPONDER FOLLOWED PROPER PROTOCALL AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. RESPONDER BROUGHT BACK THE LEAKER FOR PROPER DISPOSAL. X-2023080333: SUPERVISOR CALLED IN A HAZMAT LEAKER TO THE DMP. DMP SENT RESPONDER WITH FULL PPE AND SPILL CART TO THE LEAKER. RESPONDER ARRIVED AND CONSULTED THE DECISION TREE ON HOW BEST TO RESPOND. FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE, THE RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE LEAKER FOLLOWING THE APPRIATE STEPS. THE RESPONDER BROUGHT THE LEAKER BACK TO THE DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report E-2023080859
item.description:
Report E-2023080859

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-26
  • City: WICHITA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the metal 3,78 liter cans of petroleum distillates (un1268) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 5 ounces of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023080352
item.description:
Report X-2023080352

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-06T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-27
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A BOX HAD JUST BEEN LOADED ONTO THE IRREG BELT NEAR DOOR 48 WHEN SOMEONE NOTICED THAT IT WAS WET. A DESIGNATED RESPONDER WAS CALLED AND FOUND THE BOX TO BE LEAKING. THE BOX HAD SHIPPING PAPERS AND A CORROSIVE DIAMOND HAZARD LABEL AND THERE WAS A BATTERY INSIDE THAT HAD ACID LEAKING FROM LOOSE CAPS. THE BOX WAS PLACED IN A LINED SPILL TUB AND TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.
